_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Saputo Dairy Foods USA, LLC Murray, KY is a manufacturing facility located in Murray, KY. The town of Murray is located in Calloway County and has approximately 17,741 residents and a total area of 10 square miles. On the average, the facility employs around 295 people. The plant operates three shifts, seven days per week, 365days  per year. The SDF Murray KY facility includes 25.958 acres. Murray manufactures ESL milk products, such as flavored milks, cooking creams, coffee creamers and whipping creams. The processes used at Murray require cooling and refrigeration. In order to facilitate this, Anhydrous Ammonia is used. Immplementation of PSM and RMP has been established in order to better protect the employees at Murray, the surrounding community and the facility itself. Murray, commitment to its prevention programs include:

- Job specific training in ammonia and refrigeration for pertinent personnel.

- Training for all employees at Murray that covers general knowledge of ammonia: Where it is used in the plant and why, the risks associated with ammonia, safe exposure levels, effects of ammonia on the body, what to do in case of exposure to ammonia, and what

procedures to follow in the event that they detect ammonia or there has been an ammonia release.

- An Emergency Action Plan which includes General Information; Emergency Escape Procedures and Routes; Procedures to Account for all Personnel; Means of Reporting Fires and other Emergencies such as Medical, Chemical and Severe Weather.

The Emergency Action Plan also includes sections on: Emergency Training, Emergency Spill Response

Procedures, Plant Crisis Procedures, and Plant Emergency Contact List.

- Interaction with the local community regarding Emergency Plans and Preparedness (Local Fire Department, LEPC).

- Plant evacuation drills and training.

- A detailed Preventative Maintenance Program that is tracked using the onsite Computerized Maintenance Management System (MP2).

- Routine inspections of e

quipment, piping, and the rooms that house the equipment.

- Maintenance Rounds on Ammonia Systems.

- Contractor qualification review and training.

- A Hot Work Permit System that contractors and plant personnel are routinely trained on.

- Murray has had no reportable accidents in the past five years.

Murray continues to solidify its commitment to Ammonia Safety. Murray has a mechanical integrity program that includes system

inspections.  

Murray, is committed to providing a safe work environment for its employees.
